tagline: Production-grade AI assistants for businesses tired of chatbot theater.
positioning: I build AI assistants that actually work in production—handling real customer questions, reducing support load, and converting website visitors—without hallucination risks or performance disasters. No demos that break in production. No hype-driven tools that need constant babysitting. Just secure, measurable systems backed by 17 years of Fortune 500 IT discipline.

brand_voice.rationale: Solo consultant positioning. Direct accountability. Use 'we' only when referring to collaboration with the client (e.g., 'we'll define success metrics together').
brand_voice.tone: Confident, evidence-based, zero hype. Think senior enterprise architect who left to solve SMB problems.
brand_voice.enforcement: All customer-facing copy uses first-person singular. Kill 'studio,' 'team,' 'our agency' language.

ideal_client_profile.company_stage: Established SMBs and growth-stage companies (50–500 employees) with proven product-market fit
pain_points: Support team drowning in repetitive Tier 1 questions
Website visitors leaving without engaging (high bounce, low conversion)
Internal teams searching Slack/email for tribal knowledge instead of documented answers
Past AI experiments failed due to hallucinations or abandoned proof-of-concepts
ideal_client_profile.budget_signals: Willing to invest $5K–$25K in a system that demonstrably reduces costs or improves conversion
ideal_client_profile.decision_maker: COO, VP Customer Success, VP Sales, or technical founder with P&L accountability

delivery_model.execution: English-first project management for speed and precision. All strategy, documentation, and technical communication in English.
delivery_model.bilingual_outputs: AI assistants deliver fluent English/Spanish responses. I validate both languages in production.
delivery_model.spanish_first_clients: If your team prefers Spanish-first collaboration, I bring in a bilingual PM/solutions partner (disclosed upfront, priced separately).
delivery_model.why_this_works: You get Fortune 500-caliber execution without translation delays. Your customers get native-quality experiences in both languages.

offers.name: Clarity Sprint
offers.outcome: Walk away with a buildable plan—or a clear 'no-go' decision—before spending serious money.
deliverables: Prioritized use cases with success metrics (deflection rate, conversion lift, time saved)
Knowledge audit (what you have, what's missing, what's messy)
V1 scope with clear exclusions (no scope creep)
Fixed-price implementation proposal OR honest assessment if AI isn't the right move
offers.ideal_for: Teams with an AI idea but no clarity on ROI, scope, or technical feasibility

offers.name: RAG Assistant Build + Launch
offers.outcome: Production-ready assistant that answers customer questions using your documentation, policies, and FAQs—with source citations and graceful failure when uncertain.
includes: Knowledge ingestion pipeline (PDFs, docs, help center, Notion, etc.)
Retrieval tuning and evaluation against ground truth
Guardrails (confidence thresholds, source grounding, human handoff)
Analytics dashboard (query trends, deflection rate, unanswered questions)
Bilingual support (EN/ES) if needed
Post-launch iteration cycle (2 weeks of refinement)
offers.ideal_for: Support-heavy businesses losing 15+ hours/week to repetitive customer questions

offers.name: Website Lead-Conversion Assistant
offers.outcome: Sales-focused assistant that addresses objections, qualifies visitors, and routes high-intent prospects to sales—without slowing down your site or hurting SEO.
includes: Objection-handling scripts (pricing, features, use cases)
Lead qualification logic (job title, company size, intent signals)
Contact capture with CRM integration (HubSpot, Salesforce, etc.)
Performance-first deployment (async loading, <100ms response target)
SEO validation (no content cloaking, structured data compliance)
A/B testing framework to measure conversion lift
offers.ideal_for: B2B companies with high-value deals where 1–2 extra conversions/month justifies investment

offers.name: Internal Knowledge Search Copilot
offers.outcome: Private assistant for your team to search policies, SOPs, product docs, and onboarding materials—ending the 'Slack archaeology' problem.
includes: Secure ingestion of internal docs (Google Drive, Confluence, SharePoint, Notion)
Role-based access controls (RBAC) and audit logging
Source-referenced answers (no black-box outputs)
Slack/Teams integration for in-workflow access
Usage analytics (what's searched, what's missing, where knowledge gaps exist)
offers.ideal_for: Growing teams onboarding new hires or compliance-heavy industries needing auditable knowledge access

offers.name: AI Ops Retainer (Optimization + Monitoring)
offers.outcome: Your assistant stays effective as your business evolves—continuous improvement tied to KPIs like deflection rate, conversion signals, and response quality.
includes: Monthly knowledge refresh (new docs, policy updates, FAQ additions)
Retrieval optimization (improve answer quality based on user feedback)
Workflow enhancements (new integrations, escalation rules)
Performance monitoring and alerting
Monthly reporting with actionable insights
offers.ideal_for: Businesses that view AI assistants as infrastructure, not one-time projects

why_robert.headline: Fortune 500 discipline without the enterprise bureaucracy.
why_robert.narrative: I spent 17 years managing IT systems and teams for Fortune 500 companies—where one bug could cost millions and every deployment needed governance approval. Then I walked away to solve the same problems for SMBs who can't afford $500K consulting engagements. You get enterprise-grade security, testing, and architecture—but with solopreneur speed and direct accountability. No account managers. No offshore handoffs. Just me, owning outcomes from strategy through production.

proof_points.credibility: Managed enterprise systems, stakeholder relationships, and operational accountability at scale
On-site enterprise engagements with complex technical and political environments
Uninterrupted revenue generation—no funding, no runway, just sustainable business
Consistently moved upmarket by delivering disproportionate value
100% client satisfaction score across published reviews
Established professional network across enterprise and startup ecosystems

how_im_different.proof: I won't recommend GPT-4 vs. Claude until I understand your decision, success metrics, and failure modes. Most vendors start with the tech and retrofit a use case.
Every build includes: source-grounded retrieval (no hallucination lottery), confidence thresholds (graceful failure), audit logs, role-based access, and monitoring. Not optional add-ons—table stakes.
I tie deployments to measurable KPIs (deflection rate, conversion lift, time saved) and include iteration loops. If it doesn't move a business metric, I don't build it.
I validate Core Web Vitals before/after deployment. If an assistant slows your site, I move it to a dedicated page or optimize the embed. Your SEO and page speed aren't negotiable.
Based in Guadalajara. I understand cross-border workflows (Mexico → US/Canada), cultural nuances in Spanish localization, and time zone advantages for North American clients.

how_im_different.claim: No AI hype or fragile prompts
how_im_different.proof: I explicitly refuse: chatbots that hallucinate without consequence, 'just throw it all in the prompt' architectures, and vendors who promise AGI is 6 months away. You get honest assessments of what AI can and can't do.

not_a_fit_if: You want a $50/month chatbot widget with no strategy or quality control.
You expect guaranteed ROI or fully autonomous AI with no human oversight.
You can't provide any English-speaking point of contact for project coordination.
You're looking for the cheapest vendor rather than the right partner.
You need AI to replace your entire support team (not realistic; AI augments, doesn't replace).

pricing_philosophy.model: Fixed-scope projects with transparent pricing after the Clarity Sprint.

typical_ranges.assistant_builds: $6K–$22K (depends on complexity, integrations, and knowledge volume)

pricing_philosophy.no_hourly_billing: I price on outcomes and scope, not hours. You get predictable costs and I'm incentivized to be efficient.
pricing_philosophy.payment_terms: 50% upfront to start, 50% on delivery. Monthly retainers billed in advance.

cta.promise: We'll diagnose your situation, identify if AI is the right move, and outline next steps. No pitch deck. No commitment.

competitive_positioning.vs_chatbot_vendors: I build for production, not demos. They optimize for fast sales cycles; I optimize for systems that still work in 6 months.
competitive_positioning.vs_agencies: No account managers or offshore teams. You work directly with me—17 years of Fortune 500 IT experience, not a junior dev following a playbook.
competitive_positioning.vs_freelancers: I bring enterprise governance discipline (security, testing, documentation) that most freelancers skip. Your assistant won't be a liability in an audit.
competitive_positioning.vs_enterprise_consultancies: You get the same rigor as a $500K Deloitte engagement at SMB-friendly pricing with 10x faster delivery.
